website_summaries.verdict: This affordable unicycle is good for beginners of a range of ages and heights.
pros: With 16", 20", and 24" options, this unicycle works well for short or tall riders
The sturdy frame makes this a good option for beginners
cons: The crank shaft isn't as durable as it could be

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, hefty unicycle - perfect for learning (or re-learning ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, hefty unicycle - perfect for learning (or re-learning in my case). Highly recommend it - and the orange is a FUN color!!! Also extremely easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Steph F.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son's 12th birthday figuring that it would quickly become another piece of crap laying out by the shed un-used and forgotten. But, he really, really wanted it so I ventured to buy it. In no time at all he was riding it all over the place up and down the street, etc. and loves it! It has held up very well to the initial crashes he took while learning to ride and still looks great several months later.
customer_reviews.author: RubyMcFarland

customer_reviews.title: Not manufactured correctly
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 3 of these unicycles. The first 2 were from Fun. The left pedal won't screw in correctly. There is a flaw in the manufacture of these unicycles. The threads in the LEFT pedal crank are not correct and you cannot screw the pedal in. Next I bough a $30 more Diamond Back unicycle and clearly the parts are made from the same factory in China and I had exactly the same problem. The Left pedal won't screw in due to poor threads. Do not buy this until they get the message and manufacture a new batch of these correctly!!!!
customer_reviews.author: solomon weisgerber

customer_reviews.title: Nicely Built Unicycle
customer_reviews.text: This is a nicely built unicycle. I bought this for my middle school daughter that learned how to ride on a 20 inch wheel unicycle. This 24 inch wheel unicycle gives her more range for riding around town. Her transition time to the larger wheel unicycle was quicker than I thought it would be, less than a day. We did cut five inches off the bottom of the seat post for the seat to go almost all the way down.
customer_reviews.author: Ineedcoffee

customer_reviews.title: A good, serious starter wheel.
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect unicycle for my son, just getting up and riding for the first time. He's 6' 165# 32" inseam, and the setup fits him very well. At its price point, it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Richard R.

customer_reviews.title: The product is good quality except for the pedal
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 13 year old son. He loves and rides it all the time. The product is good quality except for the pedal. The plastic pedals broke in 2 days but we have since replaced the with metal and the unicycle works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Pace

customer_reviews.title: Well built, rugged 24" unicycle. Stands up to a lot of hard use. A++++
customer_reviews.text: The 24 inch version is great for the road once you learn how to ride. reccomend learning on a 20" an transitioning to this one. It is well built and a lot of fun to ride. A++
customer_reviews.author: SaltRunner

customer_reviews.title: I grew up unicycling and thought it would be fun to start riding again
customer_reviews.text: Quality product for the price. I grew up unicycling and thought it would be fun to start riding again. This has been a great, sturdy bike. (Im 5'4 and 115lbs, fits me easily with plenty room to raise the seat if needed.)
customer_reviews.author: Kerry J Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Have been using this for years and it takes a ...
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this for years and it takes a beating and does not break. I am 225 pounds, this thing has flown across a tennis court and not one issue
customer_reviews.author: Joe H.

customer_reviews.title: My son likes it. So far it's been able ...
customer_reviews.text: My son likes it. So far it's been able to stand up to all the "abuse" associated with learning to ride it.
customer_reviews.author: Roman Rozenshteyn

customer_reviews.title: Great ride! Seat could've a bit more cushiony
customer_reviews.text: Great ride! Seat could've a bit more cushiony. Otherwise it was just what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Purchased this for my son Logan. He loves it ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my son Logan. He loves it. Rides every day. Wants me to ride it but I'm not quite that crazy. He learned it in about 4 days, fell a lot. Not the easiest to learn, but if you have the gumption to succeed, you can do as Logan did and watch a bunch of YouTube videos and give it a shot. I've since upgraded the pedals (they send plastic with it, you will fall, you will buy more pedals) and replaced the tube twice, I think he's running over the cactus with it (not really).
customer_reviews.author: Jason J. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: The left crank shaft stripped within 3 weeks. Now ...
customer_reviews.text: The left crank shaft stripped within 3 weeks. Now I have a bummed child and need to buy a new one. Cheap metal is the culprit.
customer_reviews.author: Rob F. in VB

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: It rides terribly. Do not get this cheap peice of crap! It was welded all wrong and crooked with no way to fix it! This is not worth 20 dollars. I wish I had never bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: As I would expect from a unicycle. Very well put together. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a good starter unicycle
customer_reviews.text: It's a good starter unicycle. It comes with a stand which I didn't realize at first how important that would be (unicycles are hard to park!). Overall a good solid bike for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Diamondback Bicycles CX Wheel Unicycle
product_meta.description: The diamondback cx unicycle is ideal for beginners to intermediate riders looking for a strong and durable unicycle that is built to last. The lugged steel frame features the sturdy cap-style bearing holder fitted with over-sized cartridge bearings for added longevity. The comfortable padded saddle with built-in scuff guards and contour cranks are additional features that will enhance your first unicycling experience.
feature_bullets: Durable high-tensile steel frame w/Quick release seat height adjustment
Unicycle specific saddle with built-in scuff guards extra padding for added comfort
Lightweight aluminum alloy wheel with Black ed coated corrosion resistant spokes
16" wheel with 300mm seatpost will fit riders with inseam range for 25~28"
